newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa set for 2.5 pct growth - business.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa set for 2.5 pct growth - business.

text.p: South Africa's economy still seemed set to achieve a growth rate of 2.5 percent in 1997, the South African Chamber of Business (Sacob) said in its first economic commentary following last month's budget.

Manufacturing, which makes up close to 22 percent of gross domestic product, is expected to perform well given the competitiveness of the weaker rand. Overall growth was still likely to be lower than the 3.1 percent achieved in 1996.

Sacob said that while it would be a good year for exporters, several factors -- such as reduced government expenditure, high interest rates and pressure on the capital account of the balance of payments -- would lead to a modest growth rate this year.
